hexes.description: Hot springs bubble from cracks in the arid earth. Steam rises from carved pools at different elevations.
Fish break the surface near the reef. The Shallows teem with colorful marine life.
Reef formations create a natural harbor. Fishing boats bob at anchor.
Warm currents from underwater vents create misty patches on the surface.
The water carries an oily sheen near the corrupted eastern coastline.
The water grows deeper. Currents from the open ocean swirl against the reef.
Warm coastal waters lap against golden beaches.
Steep streets of an ancient First Age city climb the hillside. Vending machines and trolley cars everywhere.
Gentle waves carry the scent of salt and flowers from the nearby coast.
Uncommonly tall grass stretches endlessly, swaying in constant wind. Hidden paths through the Gale Fields.
A half-sunken First Age vessel rests in the shallows, claimed by coral.
A settlement built into the mountainside where legendary smiths forge rare alloys in volcanic heat.
Steam rises from a ramshackle building. The legendary scent of Hakumon's ramen draws travelers.
A plateau of craggy rock with dramatic ocean cliffs. An observatory perches at the highest point.
Wind-swept grassland. Ancient nakudama road stones mark a forgotten highway.
Deep within the Gale Fields, fish-head effigies mark the Fish Head Coven's domain.

feature.name: Road Camp
feature.description: A crude shelter offers protection from the elements.

hexes.description: Mount Arbora's snow-capped peak looms overhead. Meltwater cascades down rocky channels.
A lighthouse perches on a rocky spit. Partially built structures crumble, reclaimed by colorful crabs.
An abandoned fish market overlays a bustling spirit bazaar. Spirit fish drift between realms.
Colorful sand structures rise from the beach, rebuilt by master sculptors. The Tower of Glass glints.
Calm waters along the Gift of Shuritashi's southern coast.
The southern coast stretches toward open ocean.
The tall grass of the Gale Fields thins near the coast. A courier brigade fort guards a crossroads.
A massive bird's nest of woven branches and First Age debris between two peaks. Something enormous lives here.
A village on stilts above murky wetlands. Wooden boardwalks connect homes and shops.
Black ooze seeps from the ground. Plants are twisted and discolored. The Corruption has taken hold.
Corrupted water laps at twisted coral. Fish folk patrol these waters.
Open ocean. Fishermen say the currents pull you east.
The vast ocean. No one who sails beyond the horizon returns.

feature.name: War's End
feature.description: Crows still pick at remnants of the fallen.

hexes.description: Deep water beyond the reef. Mariners' Guild buoys mark safe passage.
Stilted walkways connect ramshackle buildings over brackish water. The smell of mud eels.
Dark waters mark the domain of the Lionfish King. Fish folk patrols lurk beneath.
The trees here move when you're not looking. Vines creep and branches shift—the Crawling Canopy.
Stone steps carved into the mountainside lead upward through thin air and alpine meadows.
Giant mushrooms tower above the forest canopy. The air smells of rich earth and mycelium.
Lake Ellior stretches before you, its dark waters hiding the submerged tiers of an ancient ziggurat.

factions.name: Fish Head Coven
factions.description: The most powerful witch coven on Obojima, controlling magical ingredient trade from the Gale Fields.

advantages.name: Magical ingredient monopoly
advantages.description: Controls rare ingredient trade across the island

advantages.name: Hidden domain in Gale Fields
advantages.description: Stronghold concealed in tall grass, warded by powerful magic

agenda.description: Expand control over ingredient sources in every region
Investigate the Corruption for arcane potential
Recruit promising young witches from across the island

obstacle.description: Competition for the same goal creates conflict

factions.name: Domain of the Lionfish King
factions.description: The Lionfish King rules fish folk warriors in the Shallows, growing paranoid since the Corruption's arrival.
factions.purpose: asserting dominion over the Shallows and coastal settlements

advantages.name: Fish folk army
advantages.description: Commands hundreds of fish folk warriors striking from the sea

agenda.description: Destroy Captain Clintock and the Pointue
Raid Tidewater and claim the Pearl of Rongol
Drive back the Corruption threatening his domain

obstacle.description: A mighty foe stands in their way

significantItems.name: The Pearl of Rongol
significantItems.description: An enormous pearl glowing with inner light, housed in the Tower of Glass in Tidewater
significantItems.effect: Grants visions of coming events; may be calling to something in the deep ocean
significantItems.history: Pulled from the sea by diver Rongol. Lightning struck the sand, creating the Tower of Glass.
significantItems.significance: A beacon calling to an unknown power in the ocean depths

significantItems.name: Chisuay's Heavenly Tea
significantItems.description: A beautifully wrapped package of fragrant tea, each blend unique
significantItems.history: Perfected by tea master Chisuay over decades in his mountaintop teahouse.
significantItems.significance: Known across all of Obojima as the finest tea

significantItems.name: The Pointue's Horn
significantItems.description: The swordfish-shaped prow of Captain Clintock's submarine
significantItems.effect: Can pierce magical barriers and stretch through narrow passages
significantItems.history: Designed by Holly Clintock and enchanted by the Mariners' Guild.
significantItems.significance: The key component of the most advanced submersible on Obojima

significantItems.name: Happy Joy Cake
significantItems.description: A delicious pastry made with love and First Age magic by Master Hu
significantItems.effect: Grants 1d4 temp HP and advantage on CHA checks for 1 hour
significantItems.history: Perfected over 50 years at the Happy Joy Cake Bakery in Yatamon.
